title: Ticket #832: DAGMan erroneously reports cycle when user log unreadable
description:
If condor_dagman is unable to read the user log file, it will claim "a cycle exists in the DAG," which is nonsensical.

To reproduce:

  1. Create "submit" containing: 
    cat > submit
universe=vanilla
executable = /bin/date
log =eraseme.log
notification=never
queue
  2. Create "dag" containing: 
    job A submit
  3. "touch eraseme.log"
  4. "chmod u-w eraseme.log"
  5. "condor_submit_dag dag"
  6. Wait for the condor_dagman job to exit
  7. Inspect dag.dagman.out, observe the following: 
    10/09 12:46:16 DAGMan::Job:8001:ERROR: Unable to monitor log file for node A|ReadMultipleUserLogs:9004:Error initializing log file /scratch/adesmet/rust/admin-19790/minimal/eraseme.log|MultiLogFiles:9001:Error (13, Permission denied) opening file /scratch/adesmet/rust/admin-19790/minimal/eraseme.log for creation or truncation
10/09 12:46:16 Of 1 nodes total:
10/09 12:46:16  Done     Pre   Queued    Post   Ready   Un-Ready   Failed
10/09 12:46:16   ===     ===      ===     ===     ===        ===      ===
10/09 12:46:16     0       0        0       0       0          1        0
10/09 12:46:16 ERROR: a cycle exists in the DAG
remarks:
